title: Kent School District - Student Rapes and Sexual Assaults - claims and records - Evans, Crave & Lackie - District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 1:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 6 states:

"Katembo v. KSD (Byrd). Mr. Byrd plead guilty to rape of a KSD student. Our attorney is Mick McFarland of Evans, Craven & Lackey. mmcfarland@ecl-law.com. (509) 455-5200. No tort claim to date. But we expect a lawsuit by victim."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Mr. Byrd.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 2:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 6 states:

"DeBarthe v. KSD (DeVeiteo). SA by guest teacher. Our attorney is Mick McFarland of Evans, Craven & Lackey. mmcfarland@ecl-law.com. (509) 455-5200. Opposing counsel Daniel Hannula of Rush, Hannula, Harkins & Kyler PLLC. The matter settled."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding SA by guest teacher.
2. All records regarding a settlement.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 3:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Hernandez-Martinez v. KSD. Sex Assault/Rape case. Our attorney is Mick McFarland. This is settled for $42k, covered by insurance. Awaiting court approval. Plaintiff’s counsel: Herrman Law Group (Tacoma). Plaintiff law firm did not allege WLAD, so received no attorneys fees, etc."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Sex Assault/Rape case.
2. All records regarding a settlement.
3. All records regarding insurance coverage.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 4:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Guzman. Student to student SA. Working with Dawn Greene at Choose Clear. #SE2898- 1 Plaintiff is represented by “My Injury Attorney” and have asked for insurance information. There was a no contact contract in place at Kentwood. There were police reports for domestic violence for situation that did not occur at school. Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Sofia Aparicio. 1-833-877-7070"

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Student to student SA.
2. All records regarding insurance information
3. All records and communications to and from Dawn Greene at Choose Clear.
4. Copies of all police reports.
5. All records and communications to and from  Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Sofia Aparicio. 1-833-877-7070
6. all records #SE2898- 1.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 5:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 7 states:

"Menard. Student to student Sex Assault. Working with Dawn Greene at Clear Risk. #S4258. We are gathering records for Clear Risk. Student claims the other student committed multiple sexual assaults while unsupervised on Kentridge school premises between October 21 and February 22. She stated she notified school administrators. She claims that safety plans were not put in place. Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Julie Kline of Schroeter Goldmark Bender. kline@sgb-law.com"

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records and communications regarding Student to student Sex Assault.
2. All records and communications to and from Dawn Greene at Choose Clear.
3. All records #S4258.
4. All records and communications to and from Plaintiff’s Lawyer:  Julie Kline of Schroeter Goldmark Bender. kline@sgb-law.com

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 6:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 3 states:

"Young v KSD (Konneh) King County Superior Court Case 23-2-24933-0 KNT.  Case assigned to Mick McFarland at Evans, Crave & Lackie, in Spokane and is covered. Plaintiff alleges a KSD bus driver raped an 11 year old child and gave her STD’s.  Case is stayed until the criminal proceeding is concluded.
Konneh is in custody, and has an assigned criminal defense counsel, Mr.  Hammerstad.  We have coordinated several interviews between Hammerstad and our employees on the advice of Mick McFarland at Evans Lackie.  At our request, SIAW hired separate civil defense counsel (Floyd at Floyd Pfluger) for our former employee, which Mick thought might reduce the likelihood of our employee being found liable and foisting off all the judgment on us.  We are following Mick’s advise and cooperating with our insurance carrier, the latter being a condition of coverage.  We are having nascent discussions about a Joint Defense Agreement, which may help us deal with records requests. No agreement has been proposed yet but Mick will go through that with you in my absence, if necessary. Plaintiff’s counsel: Ashon Dennis Washington Law Center, who is very capable but reasonable."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 memo:

1. All records King County Superior Court Case 23-2-24933-0 KNT.
2. All records regarding several interviews between Hammerstad and our employees.
3. All records regarding SIAW
4. All records regarding our former employee
5. All records regarding insurance carrier
6. All records regarding Joint Defense Agreement
7. All records and communications to and from Plaintiff’s counsel: Ashon Dennis Washington Law Center

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Parents for Change

title: Kent School District - Wendy R. Blocher, Kenny Polson, and Bissett Legal Update 3.14.24 (002) memo - District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Kent School District - Wendy R. Blocher, Kenny Polson, and Bissett Legal Update 3.14.24 (002) memo - District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 1:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 2 states:

"Wendy Blocher: Alex Higgins (Attorney in Seattle) represents Blocher. We have an agreement in principle: Agreed letter of Recommendation, reference check protocol, and pay until the end of the year, in exchange for a release and final settlement."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 (002) memo:

1. Agreed letter of Recommendation.
2. Reference check protocol.
3. Release.
4. Final Settlement.
5. All emails and correspondence to or from Alex Higgins (Attorney in Seattle) representing Wendy Blocher.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 2:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 2 states:

"Kenny Polson: Patricia Rose (Attorney in Bellevue) called me on 3.7.24 asking if we were interested in striking a deal, to wit: District pays the rest of his contract and he would be off the premises but paid until the end of the year."

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 (002) memo:

1. All records regarding the deal that was struck concerning Kenny Polson.
2. Kenny Polson contract.
3. All complaints regarding Kenny Polson.
4. All emails and correspondence to or from Patricia Rose (Attorney in Bellevue).

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST PART 3:

The attached "Legal Update 3.14.24 (002)" document sent by Kent School District General Counsel Paul Brachvogel to Dawn Marie Boster on 03.14.2024 PAGE 2 states:

Disciplinary Appeal Hearing (Bissett). Opposing Counsel is Dana R. Brown, 206 993 2414. We e agreed to April 24, 2024 in Exempt Session (RCW 42.30.140(4)). The record can be sent before the hearing on the following schedule: April 1, 2024(Delivery to the Board of the record and opposing counsel’s initial brief) April 12, 2024(District staff Response Brief due.) April 19, 2024 (Opposing Counsel Reply Brief). We agreed that no oral presentation should be made, but this may be modified by the board. Opposing attorney: Dana Brown, Burke Brown Attorneys (206) 933-2414, drb@burkebrown.com

Please provide the following public records referenced in Mr. Paul Brachvogel's Legal Update 3.14.24 (002) memo:

1. A complete copy of the record sent to the Board.
2. A complete copy of opposing Counsel's initial brief.
3. A complete copy of District staff Response Brief.
4. A complete copy of Opposing Counsel Reply Brief.
5. All emails and correspondence to or from Dana Brown, Burke Brown Attorneys (206) 933-2414, drb@burkebrown.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Parents for Change
